poem:
### The Unnatural Path

Clouds chart a course but remain unschooled,  
while the compass needle bends to whim.  
The ocean whispers dreams of dust—  
where air becomes a memory,  
and rivers run with forgotten song.  
The map was never meant for this,  
a journey stitched in silence,  
truth silenced by a theater of dusk.
